originalTitle: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
title: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
content: The African nation argues it is owed payments but Downing Street says it will fight the case.

originalTitle: Nigeria president 'in great shape' after falling at Turkey reception
title: Our President Took a Little Tumble, But He's A-Okay!
content:
Hello, Friends! Your African News Reporter Here!

Hi everyone! It's me, your friendly news reporter from amazing Africa! I have a very important and also a very happy story to tell you today. It's about our wonderful President from Nigeria, President Bola Tinubu. He's a very important person, just like the head of a very, very big family – our country, Nigeria!

Our Wonderful President! Who is President Tinubu?

President Bola Tinubu is the leader of Nigeria. Nigeria is a very big and beautiful country right here in Africa! It has so many people and so many exciting places. President Tinubu works very hard every single day to make sure all the children, like you, and all the grownups are safe and happy. He helps make good plans for schools, for doctors, and for everything that helps our country grow strong. He has a very big job, and he does it with a lot of love for Nigeria and for all of us. He is always thinking about how to make life better for everyone in our home country.

A Trip to Far Away Turkey

Guess what? Our President was on a very special trip! He traveled all the way from Nigeria to a country called Turkey. Wow, that's a long way to fly! Turkey is a beautiful country that is far, far away from Africa, in a place where Europe and Asia meet. It has so many interesting things, like old castles and yummy foods. Why did President Tinubu go there? Well, presidents often visit other countries. They go to meet other important leaders. It's like when you visit your friend's house to play and talk. Leaders go to talk about important things, like how to be good friends, how to help each other, and how to make sure peace stays in the world. They might talk about how countries can buy and sell things to each other, which helps everyone.

What Happened? Oops, a Little Trip!

So, President Tinubu was in Turkey, at a very important meeting. He was walking past many important people and soldiers. They were all standing very tall and proud. And then, oops! He took a little tumble. What does 'tumble' mean? It means he tripped and fell down. Have you ever tripped over your own feet when you were running or playing? Or maybe you tripped over a toy on the floor? It happens to everyone, big or small, even presidents! It's just something that can happen sometimes when we are walking around. No one expects it, but sometimes our feet just don't listen!

Is President Tinubu Okay? Yes, He Is Super!

The most important thing to know is that President Tinubu is absolutely, completely, 100% fine! Phew! Isn't that great news? Even though he stumbled and fell for a tiny moment, he quickly got back up. People around him helped him right away, showing how kind people can be. He stood up, smiled, and kept going with his very important work. This shows us how strong he is! It shows that even when something unexpected happens, we can get back up and continue what we were doing. Sometimes, when we fall, it can be a little bit embarrassing, but it's important to remember that it's okay. What matters is that we are safe and we get back on our feet.

Why Do Leaders Travel? Making Friends Around the World

Let's talk a little more about why presidents like President Tinubu travel so much. Imagine your school has a special event, and you invite friends from another school to come and join. That's a bit like what presidents do! They travel to meet leaders from other countries to make friends. These friendships are very important. When countries are friends, they can help each other. They can share ideas, help each other when there's trouble, and even learn new things from one another. It's like having a big, global family! By traveling, President Tinubu helps make Nigeria strong and respected all around the world. He makes sure Nigeria has many friends.

Did You Know? Fun Facts About Presidents and Trips!

Did you know that Nigeria is sometimes called the "Giant of Africa"? This is because it has more people than any other country in Africa! It's a very big and important country. Did you know that presidents often have special planes to fly them to other countries? These planes are like flying offices! Did you know that Turkey has a super famous city called Istanbul? It's one of the only cities in the world that is in two different continents at once – Europe and Asia! Did you know that it's very kind to offer a hand to someone who has tripped? It shows you care! Did you know that everyone, even very careful people, can trip sometimes? It's just a part of life! Did you know that after a trip, sometimes you just need to dust yourself off and keep going? That's exactly what our President did!

It's Okay to Trip! A Friendly Message

So, what can we learn from this story? We learn that it's absolutely okay to trip and fall sometimes. It happens to everyone, even very important people like presidents! What's most important is that we get back up. When you fall, don't worry or feel sad for too long. Just shake it off, maybe laugh a little, and keep going! It shows you are brave and strong. Life is full of little adventures, and sometimes those adventures include a little stumble. And that's perfectly fine!

Let's Be Kind to Everyone!

This story also reminds us to be kind. If you ever see someone trip or fall, what should you do? You can ask if they are okay. You can offer to help them up. Being kind to others, especially when they might feel a little bit clumsy or embarrassed, is a wonderful thing to do. We should always try to help each other and show care. Our President showed us that even after a small fall, you can still be strong and keep smiling. And we should always be ready to smile and help our friends and neighbours too.

Stay Happy! From Your Reporter

So, there you have it! Our President, Bola Tinubu, had a little trip, but he is perfectly fine and continued his important work in Turkey. He is strong, and he is doing a great job for Nigeria. Remember, it's okay to trip, but it's always important to get back up! Keep smiling, keep playing, and keep learning, my wonderful friends in Africa!
summary: Nigeria's President, Bola Tinubu, took a small tumble while visiting Turkey but is perfectly fine and continued his important work.
whyMatters: This story shows that it's okay for anyone, even important leaders, to trip sometimes, and what's important is to get back up and keep going.

originalTitle: France invites Chad president in bid to ease troubled relations
title: France invites Chad president in bid to ease troubled relations
content: Franco-Chadian military relations have been strained after Chad abruptly ended its defence agreement with France.

originalTitle: Minnesota judge orders ICE chief to appear in court
title: Minnesota judge orders ICE chief to appear in court
content: Judge orders head of ICE to explain agency's handling of bond hearings for immigrants it has detained.

originalTitle: Trump’s JPMorgan Chase lawsuit revives debanking concerns in US
title: Trump’s JPMorgan Chase lawsuit revives debanking concerns in US
content: Workers in 'risky' industries and many religious and ethnic groups have been denied access to financial services.

originalTitle: Japan says goodbye to last pandas amid strained ties with China
title: Japan says goodbye to last pandas amid strained ties with China
content: Thousands gathered in Tokyo to bid farewell to Japan’s last two pandas as they began their return to China.

originalTitle: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
title: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
content: The US federal agency says it will not play an immigration role at February's event in Milan-Cortina.

originalTitle: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
title: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
content: Young Iranians able tell the BBC how they saw friends and other people die as security forces crushed protests earlier this month.

originalTitle: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
title: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
content: The process will be available to foreign nationals without a criminal record who can prove they lived in Spain for five months prior to 31 December 2025.

title: Villa sign striker Abraham for £18.25m
content: England striker Tammy Abraham completes an £18.25m return to Aston Villa from Turkish side Besiktas.

originalTitle: Guardiola apologises to ref Hallam but 'defends' outburst
title: Guardiola apologises to ref Hallam but 'defends' outburst
content: Pep Guardiola has apologised to new Premier League referee Farai Hallam if he "feels offended", having taken issue with the official following Manchester City's victory over Wolves on Saturday. But the Spaniard said he has to "defend my club and my players".

originalTitle: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
title: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
content: Harry Kane is entering the final 18 months of his Bayern Munich contract, and the German champions are eager to keep the prolific striker, as German football writer Constantin Eckner explains.
